description: Add location awareness for more contextual results.

blocks.name: getNearbyPlaces
blocks.description: Search for places within a specified area. You can refine your search request by supplying keywords or specifying the type of place you are searching for.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: coordinate
args.info: The latitude nad longitude of place coma separated.

args.name: radius
args.info: Distance in meters over which the results must be found. The maximum allowable range is 50 000 meters. Note that the radius parameter should not be used if the value rank_by = distance.

args.name: rank_by
args.info: The order of the results. The possible values are: prominence (the default) - the results are sorted by popularity. Priority is given to the ranking of the more famous sites located in a given area. At a certain place affect the rating in the Google index, the overall popularity and other factors. Distance - the results are sorted in order of proximity to the point specified in the parameter location. If you specify distance, you must also specify one or more parameters keyword, name, or type.

args.name: keyword
args.info: The word on which the search is conducted in all contents are indexed by Google for a given place, including the name, type, address, user reviews and third-party content.

args.name: language
args.info: The language code, which should be possible to return the results.

args.name: minimum_price
args.info: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: maximum_price
args.info: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: name
args.info: The space-separated words that are being sought in the names of places.

args.name: open_now
args.info: Limit search results to only those organizations (establishments) that are open at the time of sending the request.

args.name: type
args.info: limit search results to only those places whose type corresponds to at least one of these. Types should be separated by a vertical bar (type1 | type2 | etc).

blocks.name: searchPlacesByText
blocks.description: The service responds with a list of places matching the text string and any location bias that has been set.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: query
args.info: The phrase that is searched for, such as 'restaurant'.

args.name: coordinate
args.info: The latitude nad longitude of place coma separated.

args.name: radius
args.info: Distance in meters over which the results must be found. The maximum allowable range is 50 000 meters.

args.name: language
args.info: The language code, which should be possible to return the results.

args.name: minimum_price
args.info: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: maximum_price
args.info: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: open_now
args.info: Limit search results to only those organizations (establishments) that are open at the time of sending the request.

args.name: type
args.info: Limit search results to only those places whose type corresponds to at least one of these. Types should be separated by a vertical bar (type1 | type2 | etc).

blocks.name: getNearbyPlacesRadar
blocks.description: Search for up to 200 places at once, but with less detail than is typically returned from a Text Search or Nearby Search request.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: coordinate
args.info: The latitude nad longitude of place coma separated.

args.name: radius
args.info: Distance in meters over which the results must be found. The maximum allowable range is 50 000 meters. Note that radius must not be included if rankby=distance

args.name: keyword
args.info: TThe word on which the search is conducted in all contents are indexed by Google for a given place, including the name, type, address, user reviews and third-party content.

args.name: name
args.info: The space-separated words that are being sought in the names of places.

args.name: language
args.info: The language code, which should be possible to return the results.

args.name: minimum_price
args.info: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: maximum_price
args.info: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: open_now
args.info: Limit search results to only those organizations (establishments) that are open at the time of sending the request.

args.name: type
args.info: Limit search results to only those places whose type corresponds to at least one of these. Types should be in array.

blocks.name: getPlaceDetails
blocks.description: Request more details about a particular establishment or point of interest.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: place_id
args.info: The unique text identifier, returned by the getNearbyPlaces method.

blocks.name: getImageURL
blocks.description: Get the image URL for an image of a place.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: image_id
args.info: The unique text identifier 'photo_reference', returned by the getNearbyPlaces method.

args.name: max_width
args.info: Indicate the values in pixels for the maximum width of the returned image.

args.name: max_height
args.info: Indicate the values in pixels for the maximum width of the returned image.

blocks.name: addPlace
blocks.description: Add a new place to Google Maps. The new place is available immediately in Nearby Searches initiated by your application. The new place also enters a moderation queue to be considered for Google Maps. A newly-added place does not appear in Text Search or Radar Search results, or to other applications, until it has been approved by the moderation process.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: accuracy
args.info: The accuracy of the location of the signal (in meters), which is based on the request.

args.name: address
args.info: Indicate the values in pixels for the maximum width of the returned image.

args.name: language
args.info: The language in which the title is transferred to the place.

args.name: coordinate
args.info: The latitude nad longitude of place coma separated.

args.name: name
args.info: The full name of the place. No more than 255 characters.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: The phone number of the place.

args.name: types
args.info: The category to which this place.

args.name: website
args.info: The URL-address of the official web site of the place, such as home organization page.
